title: While, During, In, For | Grammar Exercise

questions.question: It rained …………… the night …………… an hour or two.
questions.description: We use during to say when something happens. We use for to say how long something lasts.

questions.question: I met Julie ………………. my stay in America.
questions.description: We use during to say that something happens inside a particular period of time.

questions.question: I was in Canada …………….. winter.
questions.description: We use during to say that something happens inside a particular period of time.

questions.question: ……………… I was in Canada, I had some strange experiences.
questions.description: While is a conjunction. It is used to connect two clauses.

questions.question: I was on holiday ……………….. June.
questions.description: Both during and in can be used to say that something happens inside a particular period of time.

questions.question: John played tennis ………………. Alice went shopping.
questions.description: While is a conjunction. It is used to talk about two simultaneous actions or situations.

questions.question: My family lived in Australia …………. five years.
questions.description: We use for to say how long something lasts.

questions.question: The shop was closed .......................... the whole of last month.
Peter was working in the garage .......................... Susie called.
questions.description: While is a conjunction. It is used to talk about two simultaneous actions or situations.

questions.question: Yesterday we played tennis ....................... hours.
questions.description: We use for to say how long something lasts / lasted.

questions.question: My parents visited us ........................... summer.
questions.description: We use during to say that something happens inside a particular period of time.
